question: In every organism on Earth there exists a mutator gene - the X-factor, as it has come to be known. It is the basic building block of evolution - the reason we have evolved from homo habilus...
answer: You're avoiding the question I posed to you at the beginning of the hearing, Ms. Grey. Three words

question: I am avoiding a question that is decidedly loaded, Senator. The wrong person behind the wheel of a car can be dangerous. But not to live.
answer: Ms. Grey -- you work at a school for mutants in Westchester, New York. Can you tell the members of this committee what exactly you are teaching these mutants?

question: Math. History. Science. English. Athletics --
answer: You wouldn't happen to be teaching them how to use their powers to --

question: Control, Senator... we teach them control.
answer: This was taken by a state police officer in Secaucus, New Jersey. A man in a minor altercation literally melted the car in front of him. I don't know where you come from, Ms. Grey, but where I come from, you don't go melting people's cars when they cut you off. You do it the old fashioned way -- you give 'em the finger. But what you presume to tell this committee -

question: I presume nothing, I am here to tell you that in time, the mutator gene will activate in every living human being on this planet. Perhaps even your children, Senator.
answer: I can assure you, there is no such creature in my genes.

question: Itís not gonna be that easy.
answer: Not this one again.

question: I lost him.
answer: How?

question: It was Xavierís people. They knew.
answer: I want him. That is all they know because that is all you know.

question: And you may mark my words, Senator Kelly. All your plotting, all your hatred. I have plans for you. Iíve seen you come, and I will see you go.
answer: Is that what youíre looking for?

question: A piece. Only a piece.
answer: Is it enough?

question: I canít believe the President canít see it. I wouldnít be surprised if he has a mutant on his staff.
answer: Have you thought of a demonstration of some kind? Maybe use the UN Summit to our advantage. The whole world will be watching.

question: Iím not interested in the whole world, Henry... Iím interested in America. Let the rest of the world deal with mutants their own way.
answer: Where to?

question: Home.
answer: Dulles Airport.

question: Would you like some breakfast?
answer: How do you know my name?

question: Youíre not the only one with gifts.
answer: What am I doing here?

question: I brought you here so that you would be safe from Magneto.
answer: Who?

question: A very powerful mutant who for some reason has taken an interest in you. Iím not sure why, but until we find out, I must ask you to stay.
answer: No thanks.

question: Dear God... Dear... God. You... wha... Who are you... Where is Henry?
answer: Mr. Guyrich has been dead for some time Senator.

question: You mutant bastards... Whatever you do to me... no matter what youíll make me right. Every word I have spoken will be confirmed.
answer: Gosh, I hope so.

question: Are you a ìGod-fearing man,î Senator?
answer: The intention of registration act -

question: INTENTION? Intention, Senator? We are talking about mankind here. His fear. It is only a matter of time before mutants will be herded into camps. Studied for weaknesses. And eventually wiped off the face of the Earth.
answer: What is it you intend to do to me?

question: How about you sit down and leave the kid alone, alright?
answer: Sheís a mutant.

question: Yeah, well, nobodyís perfect.
answer: I think you should take a seat little fella.

question: Listen -- I donít want any trouble.
answer: Well you got trouble.

question: You can come out now, Logan. Youíre among friends. You Homo Sapiens and your guns.
answer: Thatís enough, Max!

question: Iíll never understand your regard for them, Charles.
answer: And Iíll never understand terrorists.

question: I am trying to save our kind, Charles. You should do the same.
answer: Not at the cost of lives, Max.

question: Magneto.
answer: Itís alright... itís alright.

question: The two in Alaska. Just how do you people manage to be in the right place at the right time? Still tinkering with Cerebro?
answer: What do you want with him?

question: Canít read my mind?
answer: Is that so?

question: Still trying to make the world safe for our kind. Still trying to find a way to introduce ourselves -- definitively.
answer: You definition of definitive was always a bit extreme for me, Max. What is it like these days?

question: If I could make you understand. If you could just be made to see it the way I do. The way itís going to be.
answer: The way what is going to be?

question: Iím going to change the world with or without you as a witness, Charles. And this one gets a front row seat.
answer: What do you mean to do?

question: This checkmate goes to you. I didnít want to hurt anyone. But you leave me no choice.
answer: WHAT DO YOU MEAN TO DO?

question: WHAT DO YOU MEAN TO DO?
answer: Look, I appreciate your concern. But, I do better on my own.

question: You got less than sixty miles today. Iíll make you a deal. Two days. If we havenít figured out what Magneto wants with you by then... Iíll bring you back myself.
answer: What are you going to do with her?

question: Rogue is a beautiful girl, with an extraordinary power. One that even her own family isnít able to accept. Sheís been on her own for weeks now, searching for a home. A place to belong.
answer: Forty-eight hours, old man. But if you cross me, I wonít feel any guilt about what I do to you.

question: Anything else I can get you?
answer: Some cigars. Case of beer.

question: Thereís no smoking or drinking on the school grounds.
answer: I wonít light the cigars - how about that?

question: Iíll see what I can do -- You should get some sleep. Even with your healing ability, youíre going to be hurting for a while.
answer: What if I like the pain?

question: The Professor said you were a solider. Actually, I believe he used the word mercenary.
answer: Yeah? Well I donít like to talk about my past.

question: Maybe, the Professor could help you with that.
answer: By reading my thoughts?

question: If necessary.
answer: What if theyíre naughty?

question: Get some shut-eye, slick. Scott.. I -
answer: I donít like him being here.

question: What are you talking about?
answer: You saw what happened tonight. You think Magneto wonít come after him again. You think he wonít come here if necessary. This is a school, for Godís sake.

question: If Magneto is planning to use Logan for some terrible purpose itís our responsibility to do something.
answer: I have a bad feeling about this.

question: DONíT TOUCH HER.
answer: Why is everybody up at sunrise?

question: The sun is setting, Logan. Youíve been asleep for nineteen hours.
answer: What did she do to me?

question: She borrowed your power to save her life. When she touches someone, she absorbs their strengths -- their gifts. In your case -- your ability to heal. Thatís why she keeps her body covered.
answer: I felt like she almost killed me.

question: If she held on any longer she could have.
answer: And you think it helps calling her Rogue?

question: Weíve learned to embrace what we are rather than hide it like an affliction. For some, it has become their identity. You mock the names these people choose but they wear them as badges of pride.
answer: Inspiring -- Now what am I doing here?

question: Letís take a walk. How long have you been in Alaska?
answer: I donít remember. Is that what you wanted to ask me?

question: I just wanted to make you clear on something. Personally, I donít care what Magneto wants with you. He can take those claws of yours and use them for Barbecue skewers. What I do care about is the safety of this group. The Professor is in charge, and after the Professor, thereís me. So, for the remainder of your time here, youíre going to keep that killer instinct of yours locked down so no one else gets hurt.
answer: Iíve served with men like you before. Methodical. Systematic -- Naive. You know what happens to those men in a real fight?

question: You know, you --
answer: Shut up. I got no interest in you, Xavier, or your... X-Men.

question: Shut up. I got no interest in you, Xavier, or your... X-Men.
answer: Cyclops!

question: I have a question for you, Chuck. Whatís the point?
answer: The point of what?

question: This. This whole God damn thing. Making yourselves into some sort of ìteamî of super-powered freaks. Teaching wayward mutants about classical literature. For what?
answer: The point is to step into a more evolved position of social responsibility. To recognize that there is a world out there and that we mutants are as much a part of it as normal human beings.

question: What if it never happens? What if theyíre so afraid of us that we become the enemy? -- This place is gonna be one giant cemetery.
answer: Now thatís Magneto talking.

question: No. Thatís me talking. And you know what? Itís only been thirty-two hours and you still have no idea what this guy wants with me.
answer: I believe he wants you for your Adamantium.

question: Where are we going?
answer: To find Rogue.

question: How?
answer: The brainwaves of mutants are quite different than those of the average human being.

question: You designed this yourself?
answer: Actually, Magneto helped me put it together.

question: He helped you?
answer: We were friends once... But that was a long time ago.

question: SOMEONE HELP ME. SHEíS NOT BREATHING.
answer: ROGUE?

question: HELP ME. STORM ISNíT BREATHING.
answer: YOU HAVE TO COME AND GET ME. I CANíT

question: Here, here, here... a little left. Careful.
answer: Oh God.

question: You should always work with a spotter.
answer: Heís busy right now.

question: I was thinking maybe you and me could go into town.
answer: Were you now?

question: What do you say?
answer: Not interested. Let go.

question: Suit yourself. Heís uptight.
answer: He takes his work seriously.

question: He takes himself seriously.
answer: What is it youíre failing to get at? Are you interested in me? Iím just interested. Logan, do you see this ring?

question: Iíve seen a lot of rings.
answer: Yeah, Iíll bet you have. Rogue, where have you been?

question: Logan. The Professor wants you to come with me right away.
answer: Hey Rogue, tell Jean what you were telling me last night.

question: The Professor--
answer: You remember. About women.

question: Logan--
answer: Whatever you say about them being the same...

question: This ainít Rogue!
answer: Telekinesis.

question: Jean!
answer: I do love a good check mate.

question: What do you want?
answer: Come with me and Iíll let her live.

question: You think I care about her? Iím the only one whoís sure to walk out of here.
answer: Then why donít you kill her.

question: Heís already losing control of his vitals. Respiratory. Cardiovascular. Unless we manage to replace the filter by tomorrow morning, Iím afraid.
answer: We have to find Magneto.

question: Are you all right?
answer: No. Iím... I donít know if we can do this without Charles.

question: You can still hear me... canít you. Hey. Iím sorry. About Logan. I was jealous.
answer: Well, I think thatís perfectly understandable.

question: Iíll tell you one thing though.
answer: Whatís that?

question: ... and I know you can -- It is a five minute run from the furthest distance on this island. If you are not back in this time... I will kill these friends of Xavierís. Including the young lady from the gymnasium. I think they came here to ìrescue you.î
answer: Magneto looks to his hand -- the CHIP from Cerebro.

question: Xavier is dying you know. Five minutes Logan.
answer: Magneto pulls out the chip taken from Cerebro and walks over to Jean.

question: Here -- Xavierís life.
answer: Magneto. Iíve seen the results of your machine. Iíve seen Senator Kelly.

question: Ahhhh, so the good Senator survived his fall? And the swim to shore? He is stronger than I ever could have imagined.
answer: The experiment was a failure. Kelly didnít make it. Yes, you were successful in activating his mutator gene, but you failed to take into account the rest of his body -- it wasnít ready for the strain. Kelly was dead within hours. Your machine kills.

question: Quiet...
answer: You donít understand.

question: WHAM -- THROUGH the metal skin of the flame. Logan lands in the center of the sphere on top of the machine.
answer: Magneto struggles to his feet, pulling himself up by his hands. Magneto stares at Logan, impatient.

question: The rings start revolving just as it did with Kelly, back at the lair. Spinning slowly, then gaining in speed.
answer: MAGNETIC ENERGY POURS from Magnetoís hands toward the machine, behind him Jean and Storm watch helplessly.

question: The rings are spinning around Logan at such a speed, the rings themselves are no longer visible -- merely a blur around the stationary Logan.
answer: Magneto looks at the incredible displays as MAGNETIC ENERGY flows from his hands continuing to charge the machine.

question: Donít you knock?
answer: Theyíre all asking how youíre doing. Are you feeling up to saying hello to everyone?

question: Actually Iím feeling up to leaving.
answer: Why? You have a home here now, if you want it. Everyone will...

question: What?... miss me? Charley, Iím gonna walk out the front door and trust me, it wonít be soon enough for everyone here.
answer: Of course. Everything in this room is for you.

question: Thanks, Iíll pay you back.
answer: Well if youíre going to leave then you at least owe them a goodbye. Excuse me. Excuse me.
